gurmukhi: kIXo mwshwrM mhw m`dX pwnM ] auTXo lY gdw ko BrXo vIr mwnM ]418]
transliteration: Keeyo Maas- Haaran Mahaa Maddya Paanan|| Outhyo Lai Gadaa Ko Bdaryo Veer Maanan||418||
translation: He ate flesh to his fill and drank wine excessively. After all this that proud warrior got up with his mace and marched forware.418.

gurmukhi: BjI bwnrI pyK sYnw ApwrM ] qRsy jUQ pY jUQ joDw juJwrM ]
transliteration: Bhajibaanaripekh Sainaa Apaaran|| Trase Joojh Pai Joojh Pai Jeeth Jodhaa Jujhaaran||
translation: Seeing him the innumerable army of monkeys fled away and many groups of gods became frightful;

gurmukhi: auTY g`d s`dM inn`dMiq vIrM ] iPrY ruMf muMfM qnM q`C qIrM ]419]
transliteration: Outhai Gadd Saddan Ninaddant(i) Vderan|| Phirai Round Mounndan Tanan Tachchh Taaran||419||
translation: The terrible shouts of the warriors were heard and the truncated bodies pared by the arrows were seen moving.419.

gurmukhi: igrY muMf quMfM BsuMfM gjwnM ] iPrY ruMf muMfM su JuMfM inswnM ]
transliteration: Girai Mounnd Toundan Bhasoundan Gadaanan|| Phirai Round Mounndan Su Jhoundan Nisaanan||
translation: The chopped trunks of the elephants are falling down and the torn banners are swinging hither and thither;

gurmukhi: rVY kMk bMkM s`sMkMq joDM ] auTI kUh jUhM imly sYx kRoDM ]420]
transliteration: Radai Kank Bankan Sassankant Jodhan|| Outhikooh Joohan Mile Sain Krodhan||420||
translation: The beautiful horses are rolling down and are warriors are sobbing in the battlefield, there is terrible lamination in the whole field.420.

gurmukhi: iJmI qyg qyjM srosM pHwrM ] iKmI dwmnI jwxu Bwdo mJwrM ]
transliteration: Jhimiteg Tejan Darosan Prahaaran|| Khimidaamanndjaan(u) Bhaado Majhaaran||
translation: There are fast knocking of the blows, exhibiting the glitter of swords and it seems that the lightning is flashing in the month of Bhason;

gurmukhi: hsy kMk bMkY ksy sUrvIrM ] FlI Fwl mwlM suBy q`C qIrM ]421]
transliteration: Hase Kank Bankai Kase Soorvderan|| Dhalidhaal Maalan Soubhe Tachchh Tderan||421||
translation: The beautiful horses carrying warriors as neighing and the rosary of shields alongwith the sharp shafts look impressive.421.

gurmukhi: h`k dybI krM ] s`d BYro rrM ] cwvfI icMkrM ] fwkxI ifMkrM ]422]
transliteration: Hakk Debikaran|| Sadd Bhairo Raran|| Chaavadichinkar|| Daakanidinkaran||422||
translation: A terrible war began in order in order to appease the goddess kli and the Bhairvas began to shout; the vultures shrieked and the vampires belched.422.

gurmukhi: p`qR ju`gx BrM ] lu`Q ib`QuQrM ] sMmuhy sMGrM ] hUh kUhM BrM ]423]
transliteration: Pattra Judgad Bharan|| Loutth Bittoutharan|| Sanmuhe Sanharan|| Hooh Koohan Bharan||423||
translation: The bowls of Yoginis were being filled and the corpses scattered; the clusters were destroyed and there was tumult all around.423.

gurmukhi: A`CrI auCrM ] isMDury isMDrM ] mwr mwru`crM ] b`j g`jy surM ]424]
transliteration: Achchhariouchharan|| Sindhure Sindharan|| Maar Maarouchcharan|| Bajj Gadje Suran||424||
translation: The heavenly damsels began to dance and the bugles sounded, the shouts of “Kill, Kill” and the rustling of arrows were heard.424.

gurmukhi: au`Jry lu`JrM ] Ju`mry ju`JrM ] b`jIXM fMmrM ] qwlxo quMbrM ]425]
transliteration: Ujjdare Lujjharan|| Jhoumdare Jujjharan|| Bajjiyan Danmaran|| Taalano Tounbaran||425||
translation: The warriors got entangled with one another and the fighters gushed forward; the tabors and other musical instruments were played in the battlefield.425.
